text: Nuclear proteins were isolated from brain tissue .
Briefly , after removal of supernatant ( cytoplasmic extract ) , the pellets were resuspended in nuclear extraction reagent .
The tubes containing pellets were put on vortex for 15 seconds every 10 minutes , for a total of 40 minutes .
The tubes were centrifuged at maximum speed ( ~16 , 000 x g ) in a micro centrifuge for 10 minutes .
The supernatants ( nuclear extract ) were transferred to a clean prechilled tube and stored at - 80degreesC until use .
EMSA was performed as described previously [ 8 ] .

NFkappaB binding activity was examined in a 15 muL binding reaction mixture containing 15 mug of nuclear proteins and 35 fmol [ gamma-32P ] labeled double-stranded NFkappaB consensus oligonucleotide .

A super shift assay using antibodies to <extra_id_0> P65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> P50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was performed to confirm NFkappaB binding specificity as previously described .
